intro: Psychotria maturacensis, commonly known as the Maturacensis Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It produces small, dark blue berries that are edible but have a mild, bitter taste. Psychotria maturacensis is often found in shaded, humid environments such as rainforests and undergrowth areas.
